entry.title: Timed testing
entry.summary: In a thread on the Bitcoin Development mailing list, Gavin Andresen questioned the validity of using the -regtest mode in Bitcoin nodes to generate blocks after a few seconds. He asked how this was different from just running in -regtest mode and requesting the nodes to create a block after a short period of time. The discussion revolved around the potential implications of this approach, with some suggesting that it could lead to reduced security and increased vulnerability to attacks. Others argued that it could be useful for testing purposes, but only if done carefully and with appropriate safeguards in place. Overall, the conversation highlighted the need for caution and careful consideration when experimenting with new approaches to Bitcoin development.
